snippet: The indirect talks between Israelis and Palestinians in Cairo must lay the groundwork for something bigger and more durable than one temporary cease-fire.
abstract: Editorial urges Israeli and Palestinian leaders to establish something more enduring than single cease fire during talks in Cairo; holds neither side has achieved goal of destroying the other, and that tactics employed by Hamas and Israel only prolong misery; contends establishing some form of peace is especially important because of conflict's role in larger Middle East unrest.
lead_paragraph: The indirect talks between Israelis and Palestinians in Cairo must lay the groundwork for something bigger and more durable than one temporary cease-fire.
